alert.note: Alert for Clay; Kanawha; Roane (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 28 at 7:58AM EDT until August 28 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Charleston has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Kanawha County in central West Virginia... Southern Roane County in central West Virginia... Western Clay County in north central West Virginia... * Until noon EDT. * At 758 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Clendenin. This includes the following streams and drainages... Falling Rock Creek, Queen Shoals Creek, Leatherwood Creek, King Shoals Run, Porter Creek, and Garner Branch. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
